scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: There are twelve items, 1933-1937, including correspondence and miscellaneous musical scores of probable traditional Chinese music, perhaps the result of a collaboration between Alice Darrow Rounds (Mrs. George Hayden) and Chinese musicologist Chao-Mei-Pa (1907- ) and poet Chung-yu Sen. Letters to Mrs. Rounds include one from Chung-yu Sen (February 15, 1933) inquiring about her translation of the two famous Chinese poems; one from Chao-Mei-Pa (December 31, 1934) sending copies of his songs that she had requested and mentioning his concert work; and a postcard concerning the "Old Gilman house." There is also a music- writing book of Mrs. Rounds, with loose notes concerning the songs, which include "Song of the Widow Fang Folksong," "Song of Shepherd/Song of Su Wu," "Reflection in Autumn," and "Fisherman." Oversize material includes musical scores for eight Chinese songs: "Buddhist Chant," "Chinese Song," "Drinking Song," "Fisherman," "Le Vieux Pecheur," "A Love Complaint," "Night Watches," and "The Tambourine," chiefly arranged and copied by Chao-Mei-Pa.
